intro: Dubouzetia campanulata var. glabrescens, commonly known as the glabrous bellflower, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The variety 'glabrescens' is distinguished by its smooth, hairless leaves and stems, which set it apart from other varieties of Dubouzetia. It typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This plant is often found in alpine or mountainous habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
